title: Younger, Longer Science Brief
subtitle: Decode the genetic, inflammatory, and regenerative levers that keep faces looking rested for longer.
summary: Looking younger than your age is rarely an accident. We review MC1R and FOXO3 gene research, collagen glycation, lifestyle biomarkers, and how regenerative treatments such as PRP facelifts, polynucleotides, and stem-cell therapies fit into a longevity plan.

sections.title: Genetics vs. epigenetics
sections.intro: Genes load the gun; lifestyle pulls the trigger. Here's how to work with both.

items.heading: MC1R variants
items.body: Certain MC1R copies are linked to earlier wrinkling because they produce less eumelanin. Daily SPF and antioxidants counter the oxidative load.

items.heading: FOXO3 longevity gene
items.body: People with FOXO3 variants regulate autophagy better. Mimic the effect with low-glycaemic diets, intermittent fasting, and adequate protein (1.2 g/kg).

items.heading: Epigenetic age
items.body: Inflammation, alcohol, and poor sleep accelerate methylation drift. Focus on anti-inflammatory nutrition and stress management to keep biological age younger than chronological age.

sections.title: Lifestyle levers you can control
sections.intro: Everyday choices either protect or degrade collagen.

items.heading: Glycation control
items.body: Aim for 30g+ protein per meal, swap ultra-processed snacks for fibre-rich options, and keep HbA1c below 5.2%. Glycation stiffens collagen and dulls skin.

items.heading: Sleep & circadian cues
items.body: Consistent bedtimes, morning sunlight, and limiting blue light one hour before bed keep cortisol rhythms stable and support nightly repair.

items.heading: Movement & fascia
items.body: Strength training plus facial massage devices keep fascia toned, preventing laxity and heaviness.

sections.title: Regenerative treatments that move the needle
sections.intro: When lifestyle is optimised, add targeted medical boosters.

items.heading: PRP Vampire Facelift
items.body: Liquid gold rich in growth factors boosts collagen types I & III, brightens tone, and softens texture for 12–18 months.

items.heading: Polynucleotide skin boosters
items.body: PN strands hydrate deep dermal layers, improve elasticity, and calm redness—ideal for tech neck or dullness.

items.heading: Stem-cell & exosome infusions
items.body: BMAC or adipose stem-cell therapy plus exosomes repair chronic damage in joints and skin, keeping you active and radiant.

faqs.question: Do I need genetic testing before booking treatments?
faqs.answer: Not always. We can infer risk factors from family history and biomarkers, but we do offer nutrigenomic panels if you want personalised longevity protocols.

faqs.question: How soon will a PRP facelift show results?
faqs.answer: Glow improves within 2–3 weeks, with maximal collagen remodelling at 3 months. Results last 12–18 months when paired with sleep, nutrition, and SPF.

faqs.question: Can I combine PN boosters with dermal fillers?
faqs.answer: Yes. Polynucleotides prep the skin so filler integration looks seamless. We often stage PN first, then refined filler placement two weeks later.
